page.title: 20Christleton Village Pond
page.content: Since 1974 groups of children have carried out an active conservation project on this ancient marl pit now pond.Initially a historical survey and census of the wildlife was carried out and won 2nd place in the Save the Village Pond Campaign.However since the droughts of 1975/6 a pond rescue has taken place.Each year ditches and drainage channels are cleaned,surplus reeds, rushes and floating vegetation removed,and the edges reshaped to allow more depth of water and improve access.Trees and shrubs have been planted,grassbanks cut and the fence maintained.The aim is to recreate a visual amenity for the village and to provide a safe nesting site for Mute Swans the village emblem.Marl was originally dug to fertilise the areas sandy soil,or to make local bricks. Sand was also extracted for building.
